availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Hancock County, Kentucky, attorney. Kentucky native. Married to Mary W. Hamilton Williams. Father of Hamilton Williams, Ione Williams, James R. Williams, W. A. Williams, Mary Ruth Williams, and H. A. Williams. Studied law in Louisville in the firm of Thomasson and Boone. Practiced in Hawesville and later in Owensboro. Served in Kentucky House of Representatives for Hancock and Ohio counties from 1850-51. Ran on Democratic ticket for State Senate in 1857.

bibl.p: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock, p. 40. Leo McDonough & Co., An Illustrated Historical Atlas of Daviess County, Ky. (Utica, Kentucky: McDowell Publications, 1876), 36. Find A Grave, "George Washington Williams (1814-1890)," Memorial #57361824, https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GSln=Williams&GSfn=George&GSmn=W&GSby=1814&GSbyrel=in&GSdyrel=all&GSst=19&GScntry=4&GSob=n&GRid=57361824&df=all& (accessed August, 2, 2017).
